result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Tina M. Perez was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine, blood draw fee and DNA surcharge are to be paid at $50 per month commencing 11-01-2015 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full or serve 28 days jail, consecutive as penalty for failure to pay.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Waukesha Police Department.

Huber with standard release conditions, commencing 08-31-2015 by 07:00 p.m.
FIRST FULL 20 DAYS are served through Huber.  If there are no violations resulting in the defendant being sent back to main jail, the BALANCE to be served through the Day Report Program.
GOOD TIME CREDIT APPLIED TO ALL 45 days up front.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Defendant has completed Victim Impact Panel.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Tina M. Perez in court with attorney Thomas K. Voss.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed as read ins.
Count 4 is dismissed by operation of law.

Court orders the following:  
45 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions)
First full 20 Days are through huber (if no violations - sent back to the main jail) - balance to be served through the Day Report Program.
Good Time Credit to be applied to all 45 days up front.
Defendant to report to Huber facility by 7:00 p.m. on: 08/31/15.

FINE: $ 1,179
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to City of Waukesha Police Department.
To be paid at the rate of $50 per month, starting 11/01/15 and the first of every month until paid in full.
Alternate: 28 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions) - Consecutive.

14 Months D/L REVOCATION: 
14 Months IGNITION INTERLOCK

Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel on:  Already Completed.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.    Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring within 1 business day.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing
